# Data process


## England

### Wave 1

### Wave 2

#### Study-specific variable description

| **Name** | `trig` |
|-|-|
| **Label** | `Blood triglyceride level (mmol/l)` |
| **Table name** | `wave_2_nurse_data_v2` |
| **Categories:**| `continuous` |
| **Missings:**| `-11 = Blood sample not taken`<!--<br/>`-10 = Result missing for other reason`<br/>`-9 = Sample leaked`<!--<br/>`-8 = Cannot measure parameter reliably as TRIG value >13mmol/L`--><br/>`-7 = Sample unusable (for other reason)`<br/>`-6 = Period between collection and receipt in the lab > 5 days`<br/>`-3 = Haemolysed so not suitable for particular analyses`<br/>`-2 = Sample received but insufficient blood for the test`<br/>`-1 = No sample received` |
| **Description** |  | 

   

```{r assign w2, echo=F }

opal.assign.table.tibble(o, 'ELSA_w2','ELSA.wave_2_nurse_data_v2', variables=list('trig'), missings = TRUE)
ELSA_w2 <- opal.execute(o,'ELSA_w2')

```

```{r local w2, echo=F}

vbl <- ELSA_w2$trig
vbl_miss <- -11:-1
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_miss)[3], caption = "trig") 
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = vbl_miss)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(filter(ELSA_w2,!vbl %in% vbl_miss), aes(trig)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab(label(vbl)) + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Harmonisation algorithm

To compute `triglycerides` from the study-specific variable it has to be recoded as follows:

* ` multiply mmol/L by 88.57`
* `-11 into 994`
* `-7 into 993`
* `-6 into 993`
* `-3 into 993`
* `-2 into 993`
* `-1 into 999`

**R script:**

```{r harmo w2}

ELSA_ds_w2 <- tibble(id=ELSA_w2$id)
ELSA_ds_w2$triglycerides <- car::recode(ELSA_w2$trig, "-11 = 994;-7 = 993;-6 = 993; -3 = 993; -2 = 993; -1 = 999")
ELSA_ds_w2$triglycerides[which(!ELSA_ds_w2$triglycerides %in% miss_values_vector)] <- 88.57*ELSA_ds_w2$triglycerides[which(!ELSA_ds_w2$triglycerides %in% miss_values_vector)]

```

#### Statistical description of the new harmonised variable
```{r descript w2, echo=F}

vbl <- ELSA_ds_w2$triglycerides
kable(Continuous_summary(var = vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[3], caption = ds_label)
kable(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)[2], caption = "Values")
pander(Continuous_summary(vbl, missing_values = miss_values_vector)$summary, caption = "Summary")
ggplot(filter(ELSA_ds_w2,!vbl %in% miss_values_vector), aes(triglycerides)) + geom_histogram(stat="count", fill="steelblue") + xlab(ds_label) + ylab("Frequency")

```

#### Validation
```{r crosstabulation w2, echo=F}
```

## Summary of descriptive statistics of the harmonised variable accross populations and waves



```{r summ}

l.hds <- list(w2 = ELSA_ds_w2, w4 = ELSA_ds_w4, w6 = ELSA_ds_w6)
m.hds <- list()

for(name in names(l.hds)) {
  aux_object <- l.hds[[name]]
  label(l.hds[[name]][[2]]) <- label(aux_object[[2]]) <- ds_label # Text value assigned at the DS description, at the top
  l.hds[[name]][[2]] <- labelled(l.hds[[name]][[2]], labels = cont_label)
  aux_object[[2]] <- car::recode(aux_object[[2]], "miss_values_vector=NA")
  aux_object[[2]] <- labelled(aux_object[[2]], labels = cont_label)
  m_name <- paste0("ELSA_m_ds_",name)
  assign(m_name, aux_object)
  m.hds[[name]] <- get(paste0("ELSA_m_ds_",name))
  rm(aux_object)
}

t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[1]][2])[1:6]
t.hds <- substr(t.summ,1,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)-1)
for (i in seq_along(l.hds)){
  t.summ <- summary(m.hds[[i]][2])[1:6]
  t.hds <- cbind(t.hds,as.numeric(substr(t.summ,regexpr(":", t.summ, fixed=T)+1,nchar(t.summ))))
}
t.hds <- rbind(t.hds,c("sample size", sapply(l.hds,function(wave) length(wave[[1]]))))

dimnames(t.hds)[[2]] <- c(dimnames(summary(m.hds[[1]][2]))[[2]],names(l.hds))
kable(t.hds)

```
